question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure that the code you generate is executable. Create a jumping game website featuring a red panda character (silly and cute, similar to Totoro style) with Studio Ghibli aesthetic. The background should include fantasy adventure elements. The gameplay should be similar to doodle jump.

checklist.title: Is the core jumping mechanic properly implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements the Doodle Jump style physics (gravity, jumping force, continuous upward scrolling). Check for smooth vertical movement, platform collision detection, and character control responsiveness. Score 0 if the core movement mechanics are missing, 5 if basic jumping is implemented but feels unnatural, and 10 if the jumping physics perfectly matches the Doodle Jump experience with proper acceleration curves.

checklist.title: Does the red panda character follow the Totoro-like style specifications?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the red panda character has the specified 'silly and cute' aesthetic similar to Totoro style. Character should be properly animated with at least idle, jumping, and falling animations. Check whether the character has expressive features and maintains the Studio Ghibli aesthetic (rounded shapes, soft colors, charming details). Deduct 3 points if the style doesn't match Totoro/Studio Ghibli aesthetic, 3 points if animations are stiff or missing, and 3 points if the character lacks expressiveness.

checklist.title: Is the Studio Ghibli aesthetic properly implemented in the background and environment?
checklist.description: Check whether the background includes fantasy adventure elements characteristic of Studio Ghibli works (e.g., floating islands, whimsical clouds, magical plant life, dreamy color palettes). Evaluate if parallax scrolling creates depth, if color palettes use the signature Ghibli soft pastels, and if environment elements maintain consistent artistic style. Deduct 5 points if the background lacks Ghibli aesthetic, 3 points if fantasy adventure elements are missing, and 3 points if background elements appear static without parallax effects.

checklist.title: Is the platform generation system properly implemented?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes a dynamic platform generation system similar to Doodle Jump, with platforms that appear as the character ascends. Evaluate platform variety (regular, moving, breakable, etc.), distribution algorithms (should avoid impossible jumps), and performance optimization (removing off-screen platforms). Score 0 if platform generation is missing, 5 if basic static platforms exist, 10 if there's a sophisticated system with multiple platform types and proper optimization.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as window resizing, touch vs. mouse controls, different device orientations, performance throttling) and provide friendly error handling. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Weather effects that influence gameplay 2. Collectible Ghibli-inspired items with special powers 3. Dynamic soundtrack that intensifies with height). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple jumping control systems coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to the jumping game (e.g., a built-in calculator) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive particle systems that cause lag). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating game logic/view/input handling), asset loading optimization, and rendering performance. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the game performs poorly on standard devices. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching that complements the Ghibli aesthetic 2) Proper layout spacing for UI elements like score, controls, and menus 3) Professional font system that enhances the fantasy theme (appropriate character spacing, readable yet stylized fonts). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a clashing color combination that breaks the Ghibli mood, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Character control response â‰¤ 100ms 2) Smooth animation transitions for jumping, landing, and collecting items 3) Clear visual feedback for player actions and game events. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for jerky animations during fast movements, and 5 points for inconsistent frame rates. The full score is 10 points.
